Paragraph: The World Health Organization (WHO) is a specialized agency of the United Nations responsible for international public health. The WHO was established on April 7, 1948, with the main objective of promoting health, keeping the world safe, and serving the vulnerable. The WHO is headquartered in Geneva, Switzerland, and has 194 member states.
